ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: intro music theory a lot of composition involved
new music theory, great to apply to composition
Not only did I learn the technical skills required for counterpoint and four part texture, I also learned how to compose my own work.
introduction to music theory and composition, analysis and structure.
You learn essentially all you need for basic composition. By the end you are fully equipped to write a minuet and modulate in pieces.
More foundation in my music theory and a greater vocabulary in understanding harmony and form!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: 6 person class so very student oriented
The class moves at a very solid pace, and it encourages creativity and expression.
overall structure and teaching were all very strong!

This course had a lot of work. Some kids are fast with it, some like me are slow. However, I REALLY got to know the material because of all the work. It is fantastic and applicable practice and not just pointless assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn music theory this is a good place to start and not nearly as scary as what I've heard about 211
This was a very fun class, not too stressful in terms of work, but lots of subjects covered.

absolutely recommend if you are interested in music and want to know the theory that goes behind it. also good introduction to writing your own music, whether it is in the classical style or more contemporary.

If you're interested in music, hell yes. It's a fantastic class. Although I probably won't take 211, my understanding of theory feels much more comprehensive, and my song writing vastly improved over the course of the class.
Yes, I would! It's a good build of of 110.
